rce_techniques.name: Buffer Overflow
rce_techniques.description: Exploiting a program's memory allocation by overrunning a buffer's boundary and overwriting adjacent memory.
rce_techniques.mitigation: Implementing stack canaries, using non-executable stacks, and employing address space layout randomization (ASLR).

rce_techniques.name: Command Injection
rce_techniques.description: Injecting and executing commands on a host operating system via a vulnerable application.
rce_techniques.mitigation: Validating and sanitizing all user inputs, using secure coding practices.

rce_techniques.name: SQL Injection
rce_techniques.description: Executing arbitrary SQL code on a database server through a vulnerable application.
rce_techniques.mitigation: Using prepared statements and parameterized queries, regularly updating and patching database systems.

rce_techniques.name: Cross-Site Scripting (XSS)
rce_techniques.description: Injecting malicious scripts into content from otherwise trusted websites.
rce_techniques.mitigation: Encoding data on output, using Content Security Policy (CSP), validating user inputs.

rce_techniques.name: Server-Side Request Forgery (SSRF)
rce_techniques.description: Manipulating a server to make requests to internal services within the organization or to external third-party systems.
rce_techniques.mitigation: Whitelisting allowable resources, employing proper URL parsing and validation.

rce_techniques.name: Remote File Inclusion (RFI)
rce_techniques.description: Exploiting vulnerabilities in web applications to execute remote files from a server.
rce_techniques.mitigation: Disabling remote file inclusion, validating user inputs, and maintaining updated software.

rce_techniques.name: Local File Inclusion (LFI)
rce_techniques.description: Exploiting vulnerabilities to include files on a server through the web application.
rce_techniques.mitigation: Validating user inputs, employing proper file handling, and updating software.

rce_techniques.name: Deserialization Vulnerability
rce_techniques.description: Exploiting insecure deserialization to execute arbitrary code within an application's context.
rce_techniques.mitigation: Avoiding serialization of sensitive data, implementing integrity checks, and using secure serialization libraries.

rce_techniques.name: Unrestricted File Upload
rce_techniques.description: Uploading files with dangerous types that can be executed on the server.
rce_techniques.mitigation: Restricting file types, scanning uploaded files for malware, and segregating file storage.

rce_techniques.name: Remote Code Execution via Third-party Services
rce_techniques.description: Exploiting vulnerabilities in third-party services and libraries to execute code remotely.
rce_techniques.mitigation: Regularly updating third-party services and libraries, auditing for known vulnerabilities.
